intro: Otopappus australis, commonly known as the Australian sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and hairy. Otopappus australis is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
